definition: to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
to exceed/to overtake/to surpass/to transcend/to pass/to cross/ultra-/super-

sentences.english: Fire Thunder to play a maximum power of catching up after school kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 發揮上限的烈火雷霆學了後威力趕超菜刀。

sentences.english: The key to the catching-up of the developing country is to nurture factors and enhance technical capability.
sentences.chinese: 後發技術趕超的關鍵就是培育要素，提升技術能力。

sentences.english: Because we Chinese are catching-up with America.
sentences.chinese: 因爲我們中國人正在趕超美國。

sentences.english: The battle to catch Google grows harder by the day.
sentences.chinese: 趕超谷歌的戰役難度與日劇增。

sentences.english: Last year, China surpassed India to send the most students to the US.
sentences.chinese: 去年，中國趕超印度成爲留美學生最多的國家。

sentences.english: Learn from the advanced, then we may have been able to outrank them.
sentences.chinese: 學習先進，纔有可能趕超先進。

sentences.english: Our heroes happen upon a Bug Pokémon Catching Contest.
sentences.chinese: 我們的英雄時發生錯誤神奇寶貝趕超競賽。

sentences.english: A: It is said that your company has caught up with and even surpassed some world-famous enterprises.
sentences.chinese: 聽說您的公司在實力上已經趕超了一些世界知名企業。

sentences.english: After the start, Aaron Kwok again overtook Sean He at the first lap.
sentences.chinese: 郭富城在第一圈趕超杆位的何賢磊。

sentences.english: Finishing the year ahead of Raul in the European goalscorers chart?
sentences.chinese: 年底時趕超勞爾排在歐戰射手榜最前面？
